c74object.name: sp.eraetouch
c74object.digest: Interface for the Erae Touch controller
c74object.description: Interface for the Erae Touch controller.

discussion.p: The sp.eraetouch acts as the API parser to/from the Erae Touch as well as creating the LED feedback for multiple zones. You can connect this to sp.gridmatch for corpus-based sample playback or use the XYZ outputs directly for anything else in Max.

outlet.description: XYZ position from the Erae Touch or UI input.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear all LEDs. Applies to all the zones.

method.name: color
method.digest: Set the color mapping for the LEDs
method.description:
Set the color mapping for the LEDs. The color is based on the 3rd dimension of the analyzed dataset and then is projected onto the Erae Touch's LEDs using one of several color maps.
The available options are:
linear = Black - Blue - Green - Orange - Yellow map. The most perceptually accurate mapping.
rainbow = Vivid rainbow colour map from blue to red with a small perceptual blind spot at yellow. Beware, the vivid colours may make you segment regions in your data on the basis of the colours in the map rather than the structure in your data.
cyclic = Attractive six-colour cyclic with primaries and secondaries matched in lightness.
greyscale = Standard grey scale.
colorblind = Linear map with maximal chroma for Protanopic/Deuteranopic viewers.
hsl = Even distribution based on Hue, Lightness, and Saturation. Offers wide visual contrast at the cost of distance accuracy in the data.
As a rule of thumb linear offers the most accurate display and hsl offers the most visual contrast.

method.name: initialize
method.description: Initialize and connect Erae Touch. It should connect automatically but if it has not you can force it with this.

method.name: zones
method.digest: Sets the amount of available zones
method.description: Sets the amount of available zones. Sets how the corpora are drawn to the available LEDs internally.

entry.name: list
entry.description: XYZ position from the Erae Touch or UI input.
